sanskrit_verse:
वर्तयंश्च शिलौञ्छाभ्यामग्निहोत्रपरायणः ।
इष्टीः पार्वायणान्तीयाः केवला निर्वपेत्सदा ॥ ४.१०॥
transliteration:
vartayaṃśca śilauñchābhyāmagnihotraparāyaṇaḥ |
iṣṭīḥ pārvāyaṇāntīyāḥ kevalā nirvapetsadā || 4.10||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who maintains the sacred fire with offerings of stone and grass, devoted exclusively to Agnihotra, shall always perform the Pārvāyaṇa offerings separately and purely.
jurisprudential_principles: Capacity-based responsibility rooted in spiritual discipline
Restoration logic through purified ceremonial action
Consciousness alignment by exclusive dedication to dharma
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent performs Agnihotra continuously THEN qualify for Pārvāyaṇa offering autonomy
IF consecration materials include śilā AND kuśa THEN validate procedural integrity
IF devotion is undivided THEN grant jurisdiction over personal sacrificial domain
IF offering sequence disrupted THEN initiate completion protocol through repetition
IF purity maintained THEN enable independent liturgical execution rights
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters concerning ritual sovereignty or liturgical dispute, the threshold of responsibility lies in demonstrable continuity of practice. Authority derives not from institutional title but from sustained alignment with dharmic process. The court must recognize that restoration occurs through resumption of pure sequence rather than punitive correction.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa is established through observable consistency in ritual performance. Anupūrvaśaḥ manifests as sequential fidelity to prescribed acts. Responsibility aligns proportionally with the capacity to sustain unbroken engagement. There is no punitive element; deviation merely necessitates realignment through repetition.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Re-initiation of interrupted sequences until completion achieved
Verification of material authenticity before proceeding
Reaffirmation of intent through conscious renewal
Isolation of contaminated elements without disqualification of actor
Guided reintegration into ceremonial rhythm under qualified supervision
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this ordinance is executed. Dharma is restored through disciplined repetition. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness alone adjudicates truth.
